h2.a: Correction – April Odyssey School Board Meeting Thursday, April 16th

div.div: Principal – Scot Hooper is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting. April School Board Meeting Thursday, April 16th at 6:30 pm. Join Zoom Meeting https://us04web.zoom.us/j/5267812151?pwd=VE1NSDVadDFnWEpvNDFaczJLbTRPdz09 Meeting ID: 526 781 2151 Password: 990843

If you purchased a yearbook, we will make sure that you get it. The books will not be shipped to the school until this summer due to the school closings. You will still be able to buy a 2020 yearbook this summer and also in August. A four-page supplement section will be added to th

h2.a: A Letter from our Administrative Team

div.div: Parents and Guardians: Please see the attached letter from our Assistant Principals Ms. Bickerstaff and Mrs. Smith. Thank you for your continued support! Copy of Odyssey Parent Letter 04132020 3

h2.a: Online Learning is back in session

div.div: Welcome back! We hope you all had a nice and healthy Spring Break! Online learning for scholars in grades 3rd- 8th is now back in session. Scholars in grades K-2nd should have received their learning packet over the break. If you did not receive one, please contact your scholars te

Next week is Spring Break and scholars will not be required to sign in. Online learning for grades 3rd- 8th will resume on Monday, April 13th. Packets for grades K-2nd have been mailed and will be received soon. Have a safe and healthy Spring Break. Stay well!

h2.a: Important Information Regarding Georgia School Closures

div.div: On April 1, 2020, Governor Kemp announced that all Georgia public schools will remain closed through the end of the school year. Since Odyssey Charter School has been operating with online classrooms, we will continue to teach our scholars through online learning for the remainder of

h2.a: School Safety Chill Concert online tonight

div.div: “Join us Tonight for our School Safety Chill” The School Safety Advocacy Council (SSAC) recognizes that during these difficult times, we need to turn off the TV, and just CHILL… We will get through this, but it’s our Hard Working, Dedicated 1st Responders that

h2.a: An invitation from the Georgia Department of Education

div.div: Talking To and Supporting Our Children During the Pandemic Join us for a webinar on Apr 02, 2020 at 2:00 PM EDT. Register now! We invite parents and others caring for children during the pandemic to join a webinar this Thursday, April 2nd at 2:00 p.m., as Dr. David Schonfeld joins us

CDC released an updated website aimed at keeping children healthy during the pandemic. Caring for Children: Tips to keep children healthy while school’s out (March 29) https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/daily-life-coping/children.html

Here are some resources that are available to our scholars and families. Family Resources COVID.PDF to print (the 4 below pages) Click to enlarge photos below Resource Guide 2020 Free Student Meals Resources For Parents and Caregivers Crisis Resources
